topic.description: Apply key concepts to two-step problems at GED entry level. Questions mirror the lower range of what the actual test expects.

topic.title: Life Science: Ecosystems
topic.description: Apply biological concepts to two-step questions about cell function, inheritance patterns, and ecosystem interactions at GED entry level.

topic.title: Physical Science: Chemistry
topic.description: Apply physics and chemistry concepts to two-step problems involving force, energy transfer, atomic structure, and chemical reactions at GED entry level.

topic.title: Earth & Space Science: Geological Time
topic.description: Interpret maps, cross-sections, and climate data. Questions require applying knowledge of Earth's systems to analyse scenarios in the style of GED Science items.

topic.title: Life Science: Human Body Systems
topic.description: Interpret diagrams, data tables, and experimental results related to life science — question structures reflect the GED Science test's emphasis on science practices.

topic.title: Scientific Practices: Data Reasoning
topic.description: Work through multi-step problems in realistic contexts with question structures and difficulty that closely mirror the actual GED exam.

topic.title: Physical Science: Newton's Laws of Motion
topic.description: GED-level and above: multi-concept scenarios combining forces, energy, and chemical principles in real-world applied contexts. Data-heavy items require careful quantitative reasoning.

topic.title: Earth & Space Science: Weather and Climate
topic.description: GED-level and above: complex questions integrating multiple Earth-science systems — climate feedback, plate tectonics, resource cycles, and astronomical events in applied contexts.

topic.title: Life Science: Photosynthesis & Respiration
topic.description: GED-level and above: complex multi-step questions on evolution, gene expression, ecological modelling, and experimental design. Expect dense scenario stems and data interpretation.

topic.title: Scientific Practices: Experimental Design
topic.description: GED-level and above — complex, multi-concept questions with tight answer choices and scenario-based stems that match or exceed real test difficulty.

topic.title: Physical Science: Energy Transformations
topic.description: GED-level and above: multi-concept scenarios combining forces, energy, and chemical principles in real-world applied contexts. Data-heavy items require careful quantitative reasoning.

topic.title: Scientific Practices: Data Interpretation

topic.title: Earth & Space Science: Ecosystems
topic.description: GED-level and above: complex questions integrating multiple Earth-science systems — climate feedback, plate tectonics, resource cycles, and astronomical events in applied contexts.

topic.title: Life Science: Genetics and Heredity
topic.description: GED-level and above: complex multi-step questions on evolution, gene expression, ecological modelling, and experimental design. Expect dense scenario stems and data interpretation.

topic.title: Physical Science: Forces and Motion
topic.description: GED-level and above: multi-concept scenarios combining forces, energy, and chemical principles in real-world applied contexts. Data-heavy items require careful quantitative reasoning.

topic.title: Life Science: Natural Selection
topic.description: GED-level and above: complex multi-step questions on evolution, gene expression, ecological modelling, and experimental design. Expect dense scenario stems and data interpretation.

topic.title: Physics in Motion
topic.description: Apply physics and chemistry concepts to two-step problems involving force, energy transfer, atomic structure, and chemical reactions at GED entry level.

topic.title: Earth & Space Systems
topic.description: Connect earth and space science concepts to two-step questions about geological processes, climate patterns, and solar-system structure at GED entry level.

topic.title: Whole Numbers, Fractions & Decimals
topic.description: Build confidence with whole numbers, fractions, decimals, and basic arithmetic — the bedrock skills every GED math question assumes you have.

topic.title: Ratios, Proportions & Percents
topic.description: Sharpen your number-sense toolkit: work through multi-step calculations, signed numbers, order of operations, and real-number conversions at GED entry level.

topic.title: Statistics & Probability
topic.description: Interpret tables, bar graphs, and line graphs to answer two-step questions about trends, averages, and basic statistical reasoning.

topic.title: Expressions & Polynomials
topic.description: Solve two-step equations, evaluate expressions, and work with basic linear functions. Concepts and difficulty align with the lower range of GED Mathematical Reasoning.

topic.title: Equations & Inequalities
topic.description: Solve two-step equations, evaluate expressions, and work with basic linear functions. Concepts and difficulty align with the lower range of GED Mathematical Reasoning.

topic.title: Graphing & Functions
topic.description: Solve two-step equations, evaluate expressions, and work with basic linear functions. Concepts and difficulty align with the lower range of GED Mathematical Reasoning.

topic.title: Interactive Graphing (Plot & Draw)
topic.description: Practice plotting points and drawing lines on a coordinate plane. Some questions require you to graph your answer directly; others ask you to read information from a graph.

topic.title: Geometry Basics
topic.description: Learn to identify shapes, read basic formulas, and calculate area and perimeter with whole-number dimensions — geometry from the ground up.

topic.title: Us Hist Foundations Practice 1 (Foundations)
topic.description: Review key events, eras, and figures in U.S. history — the factual baseline that the GED Social Studies test expects every student to know.

topic.title: Us Hist Foundations Practice 2 (Core Skills)
topic.description: Connect historical events to their causes and effects. Questions address major turning points from colonisation through the 20th century at GED entry level.

topic.title: Us Hist Foundations Practice 3 (Test Ready)
topic.description: Analyse primary and secondary sources about U.S. historical events. Questions require evaluation of historical arguments and evidence in the style of GED Social Studies items.
